So Update. I cut a few things out like the Rioter name viewing my case but this was basically the result of what i was told. 

I've taken some time to go through your logs and I'll admit, I’m really sorry you had to deal with that kind of behavior. I’ll take a look at the match and follow up with any players who were negative and make sure appropriate actions were taken. I’m sorry to say, but when it comes to the placement of this penalty, I don't have great news. I won’t be able to reduce this for you, but I want to take this time to provide you with context as to why this penalty has been applied and tips to prevent any future ones when faced with these types of games.

After taking some time to look through your chat, it does look like there was quite a lot of typing. When queuing up for a match, we all have the same goal in mind and that's to get a win. Communicating with your teammates is absolutely critical in helping your team achieve victory but sometimes typing too much can be more of a hindrance - rather than helpful.

If other players are causing issues in your game, please do make liberal use of your mute function. Players often forget how powerful this simple feature can change the course of the match.

Short phrases like:“Ult soon, ward dragon”, "Catch somebody out there, wait with me", are really effective and get straight to the point. In addition, I'd suggest using smart pings and emotes when you need to communicate quickly. The less time we spend in chat, the more time we can think about executing a plan of action.

Dude I feel for you. Got hit with my apparently now yearly 10-game chat restriction again this year as I've been slogging my way out of bronze. 

Had a duo on my team who teamed up on me and turned the entire team against me. I was ADC and my Senna support kept taking CS, literally purposely denying me farm by last hitting whatever I was trying to kill. Then flaming me and calling me names, etc.

I lost my cool and called him a "fking moron" and then these 2 spent the rest of the game flaming me, then they campaigned in /all chat to 9x report me. I stopped chatting altogether and muted them, but knew that the damage was done. They had me if they got enough reports on me.  

3 games later I got hit with the restriction and my honor is back to level 1. Damn.

Oh well. On the plus side, after the punishment I've won every game and already got through the 10 game restriction. But damn, playing through bronze back to silver is a  pain when you are stuck with perma-bronze and iron players who obviously don't care, have no idea what they are doing, and enjoy tilting their own teammates. It's a real test of patience and I'm sure we aren't alone in the normally chill players who lose their patience and their cool and then get hit with punishments.

I just hope to hit Honor 2 before clash starts. My team is relying on me at ADC. I'm feelin the shame when I have to tell them I got punished.  rip

If multiple reports were part of the algorithm we would not see cases where people are banned while part of a 4-man pre-made. 

It's not unheard of for someone to come to the board confused about their ban because they didn't think that it was punishable if the chat wasn't directed at the person reporting (and all their friends were fine with the verbal roughhousing).

If it took multiple reports for the system to spot those games those people would never had been punished for their chat.
I believe single reports ARE valid, I'm just saying that multiple reports increase the probability action will be taken.

> [{quoted}](name=Happy Mustache,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7WLh7l1A,comment-id=00020000000200000000000000000000000000000000000100000001,timestamp=2020-01-23T13:25:26.737+0000)

Based on no real proof nor logical standpoint.

Keep in mind, the system is largely automatic. If the system relied on manual reviews your opinion would have some foundation to work on since it would make sense to prioritize games with multiple reports to save review hours because they're less likely to be frivolous when multiple individuals report someone and

But it's not. It's a computer scanning the logs so there is no need worry about saving time. It would actually take more effort to program a system that has multiple levels of priority based on how many reports were issued in a game compared to one that just checks if a report was made. 

Prioritizing games with multiple reports only result in negative effects for such a system because that would mean that games where one person is harassed by many would more likely get overlooked.
